page.title: 05THE VILLAGE GREEN
page.content: The Village Green which at 24 acres is one of the largest in the country has remained virtually unchanged for many hundreds of years. 49 houses surround it including only 7 less than 20 years old; many being over 200 years old. Bisecting the Green is a stream which flows through a variety of trees, wild flowers and grasses. 3 farmers have the hay rights and, historically, those who live on the Green (commoners) enjoy grazing rights. Some do try to extend their land by encroaching on the Green, but local vigilance ensures little success in this respect. By ancient law the Green is common land, open to all. It includes a cricket field crossed near the boundary by the council road, the Council choosing to ignore the original track around the Green. Out- going batsmen have to cross this road to reach their dilapidated pavilion.
